src:
Buyer Meet Sellers, Forum Bisnis Akses Pasar Produk Perikanan
05 Nov 2019, 10:41 by Anik Hasanah


Buyer Meet Sellers, Forum Bisnis Akses Pasar Produk Perikanan

KBRN, Surabaya : Potensi produk perikanan untuk dapat merambah pasar nasional bahkan internasional cukup besar, untuk itu Pemerintah senantiasa mengajak para produsen terlebih pelaku Usaha Kecil Menengah (UKM) mengikuti pameran. Kepala Seksi Akses Pasar, Promosi dan Logistik, Bidang Pengolahan dan Pemasaran Produk dan Kelautan, Dinas Perikanan dan Kelautan Jatim, Farida menyebut, produk hasil pengolahan perikanan milik UKM tidak kalah berkualitas dari industri. "Kesulitannya adalah akses pasar," ujarnya, disela acara forum bisnis Buyer meet Sellers for Fish and Marine Product di Surabaya, Selasa (5/11/2019).Salah satu membuka akses pasar ini, Dinas Perikanan dan Kelautan Jatim menyelenggarakan forum bisnis Buyer meet Sellers for Fish and Marine Product, dengan menghadirkan 50 seller atau penjual yang terdiri dari pelaku UKM produk perikanan. "Yang tersebar di Kabupaten Kota di Jawa Timur," tambahnya. Selain itu, juga menghadirkan para buyer atau pembeli, dimana mereka adalah terdiri dari 50 orang yang masing-masing berasal dari berbagai asosiasi seperti Kamar Dagang dan Industri (KADIN), Himpunan Pengusaha Muda Indonesia (HIPMI), maupun Ikatan Wanita Pengusaha Indonesia (IWAPI). "Kita akan membahas mengenai efisiensi pola distribusi produk Kelautan dan Perikanan, peningkatan transaksi pelaku usaha melalui finansial teknologi," tuturnya. Kegiatan ini, kata Farida, bertujuan untuk mempertemukan antara pembeli dan penjual yakni kelompok usaha kecil menengah atau UKM maupun kelompok pengelola, dan memasarkan produk Kelautan dan Perikanan."Dalam rangka memfasilitasi para pelaku usaha, untuk dapat membuat kontrak langsung dengan pembeli, demi mewujudkan program Nawa Bhakti Satya yang digagas oleh Gubernur Jawa Timur," pungkasnya.
text:
Buyer Meet Sellers, Business Forum, Fisheries Product Market Access
05 Nov 2019, 10:41 by Anik Hasanah


Buyer Meet Sellers, Business Forum, Fisheries Product Market Access

KBRN, Surabaya: The potential of fishery products to be able to penetrate the national and even international markets is quite large, for that the Government always invites producers, especially Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) participants to take part in the exhibition. Head of Market Access, Promotion and Logistics Section, Product and Marketing Processing and Maritime Affairs, East Java's Fisheries and Maritime Affairs Office, Farida said, SME's fishery products are no less qualified than the industry. "The difficulty is access to markets," he said, interrupted by the Buyers for Fish and Marine Product Buyer meet business forum in Surabaya, Tuesday (11/5/2019). One of the open market accesses, the East Java Fisheries and Fisheries Office held a Buyer meet business forum Sellers for Fish and Marine Products, by presenting 50 sellers or sellers consisting of SMEs of fishery products. "Which is spread in Kota Regency in East Java," he added. In addition, it also presented buyers or buyers, where they consisted of 50 people, each from various associations such as the Chamber of Commerce and Industry (KADIN), the Indonesian Young Entrepreneurs Association (HIPMI), and the Indonesian Women Entrepreneurs Association (IWAPI) . "We will discuss the efficiency of marine and fisheries product distribution patterns, increase business transactions through financial technology," he said. This activity, said Farida, aims to bring together buyers and sellers, namely small and medium business groups or SMEs as well as management groups, and to market Marine and Fisheries products. "In order to facilitate business actors, to be able to make contracts directly with buyers, in order to realize the program "Nawa Bhakti Satya, which was initiated by the Governor of East Java," he concluded.
